metalign.parsing

Interface NoteEventParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoteListGenerator

    public interface NoteEventParser
    A NoteEventParser is any class which can handle MIDI Note On and Note Off events. These are normally passed to it by a MidiEventParser.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 11 Feb, 2015

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void noteOff(int key, long tick, int channel)
      Process a Note Off event.
      MidiNote noteOn(int key, int velocity, long tick, int channel)
      Process a Note On event.

    • Method Detail

      • noteOn

        MidiNote noteOn(int key,
                int velocity,
                long tick,
                int channel)
        Process a Note On event.
        Parameters:
        key - The key pressed. This will be a number between 1 and 88 for piano.
        velocity - The velocity of the press. This is a value between 1 and 127 inclusive.
        tick - The midi tick location of this event.
        channel - The midi channel this note came from.
        Returns:
        The MidiNote we just created.

      • noteOff

        void noteOff(int key,
             long tick,
             int channel)
      throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Process a Note Off event.
        Parameters:
        key - The midi key which has been turned off. This value is between 39 and 127, inclusive, for piano.
        tick - The midi tick location of this event.
        channel - The midi channel this note came from.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If a note off event doesn't match any previously seen note on events.
